verses.kjv: Now when these things were done, the princes came to me, saying, The people of Israel, and the priests, and the Levites, have not separated themselves from the people of the lands, doing according to their abominations, even of the Canaanites, the Hittites, the Perizzites, the Jebusites, the Ammonites, the Moabites, the Egyptians, and the Amorites.
verses.ct: After all this had been taken care of, some of the leaders approached me and said, "The people of Israel, including the priests and the Levites, have not kept themselves separate from the surrounding peoples and their disgusting practices — the Canaanites, Hittites, Perizzites, Jebusites, Ammonites, Moabites, Egyptians, and Amorites.

verses.kjv: For they have taken of their daughters for themselves, and for their sons: so that the holy seed have mingled themselves with the people of those lands: yea, the hand of the princes and rulers hath been chief in this trespass.
verses.ct: They have married women from these nations for themselves and for their sons, so that the holy people have mixed themselves with the peoples of these lands. And the leaders and officials have been the worst offenders in this violation."

verses.kjv: And when I heard this thing, I rent my garment and my mantle, and plucked off the hair of my head and of my beard, and sat down astonied.
verses.ct: When I heard this, I tore my clothes and my robe in grief, pulled hair from my head and my beard, and sat down in shock.

verses.kjv: Then were assembled unto me every one that trembled at the words of the God of Israel, because of the transgression of those that had been carried away; and I sat astonied until the evening sacrifice.
verses.ct: Everyone who trembled at the words of the God of Israel gathered around me because of this violation committed by the returned exiles. I sat there in shock until the evening sacrifice.

verses.kjv: And at the evening sacrifice I arose up from my heaviness; and having rent my garment and my mantle, I fell upon my knees, and spread out my hands unto the LORD my God,
verses.ct: At the time of the evening sacrifice, I got up from my grief, and with my clothes and robe still torn, I dropped to my knees and stretched out my hands to the LORD my God.

verses.kjv: And said, O my God, I am ashamed and blush to lift up my face to thee, my God: for our iniquities are increased over our head, and our trespass is grown up unto the heavens.
verses.ct: I prayed, "My God, I am too ashamed and humiliated to even look up at you, my God, because our sins have piled up over our heads, and our guilt has reached all the way to the heavens.

verses.kjv: Since the days of our fathers have we been in a great trespass unto this day; and for our iniquities have we, our kings, and our priests, been delivered into the hand of the kings of the lands, to the sword, to captivity, and to a spoil, and to confusion of face, as it is this day.
verses.ct: From the time of our ancestors until today, we have been deeply guilty. Because of our sins, we, our kings, and our priests have been handed over to foreign kings — to the sword, to captivity, to plundering, and to total humiliation, just as it is today.

verses.kjv: And now for a little space grace hath been shewed from the LORD our God, to leave us a remnant to escape, and to give us a nail in his holy place, that our God may lighten our eyes, and give us a little reviving in our bondage.
verses.ct: But now, for a brief moment, the LORD our God has shown us grace by preserving a remnant of us and giving us a secure place in his holy location, so that our God might restore our vision and give us a little relief in our slavery.

verses.kjv: For we were bondmen; yet our God hath not forsaken us in our bondage, but hath extended mercy unto us in the sight of the kings of Persia, to give us a reviving, to set up the house of our God, and to repair the desolations thereof, and to give us a wall in Judah and in Jerusalem.
verses.ct: We were slaves, yet our God has not abandoned us in our slavery. Instead, he has shown us mercy in the eyes of the kings of Persia, giving us new life to rebuild the house of our God, to restore its ruins, and to give us protection in Judah and Jerusalem.

verses.kjv: And now, O our God, what shall we say after this? for we have forsaken thy commandments,
verses.ct: But now, our God, what can we possibly say after all this? Because we have abandoned your commandments,

verses.kjv: Which thou hast commanded by thy servants the prophets, saying, The land, unto which ye go to possess it, is an unclean land with the filthiness of the people of the lands, with their abominations, which have filled it from one end to another with their uncleanness.
verses.ct: which you gave through your servants the prophets when you said: 'The land you are entering to take possession of is a polluted land, contaminated by the peoples living there and their disgusting practices. They have filled it from one end to the other with their impurity.

verses.kjv: Now therefore give not your daughters unto their sons, neither take their daughters unto your sons, nor seek their peace or their wealth for ever: that ye may be strong, and eat the good of the land, and leave it for an inheritance to your children for ever.
verses.ct: So do not give your daughters in marriage to their sons, and do not take their daughters for your sons. Never promote their prosperity or well-being, so that you may be strong and enjoy the good things of the land and pass it on as an inheritance to your descendants forever.'

verses.kjv: And after all that is come upon us for our evil deeds, and for our great trespass, seeing that thou our God hast punished us less than our iniquities deserve, and hast given us such deliverance as this;
verses.ct: After everything that has happened to us because of our wicked actions and our enormous guilt — even though you, our God, have punished us far less than our sins deserved and have given us this deliverance —

verses.kjv: Should we again break thy commandments, and join in affinity with the people of these abominations? wouldest not thou be angry with us till thou hadst consumed us, so that there should be no remnant nor escaping?
verses.ct: should we go right back to breaking your commandments and intermarrying with peoples who practice these disgusting things? Wouldn't you be so angry with us that you would destroy us completely, leaving no survivors at all?

verses.kjv: O LORD God of Israel, thou art righteous: for we remain yet escaped, as it is this day: behold, we are before thee in our trespasses: for we cannot stand before thee because of this.
verses.ct: LORD, God of Israel, you are righteous. We survive today only as a remnant. Here we stand in your presence with all our guilt, and because of it, not one of us can stand in your presence."
